child.name: Competency is established by college-level course work equivalent to UCIs fifth quarter of study (usually 2B).
Select two upper-division courses in any one geographic area.

Visit the Global and International Studies website for a list of approved courses. Although some courses are listed in more than one focus, students may not double count a course for both their geographic and global focus areas. Study abroad counts as one course in the geographic focus.
Select five upper-division courses. At least two courses must be from Module A.
For a quarterly list of approved upper-division courses, please visit the Social Sciences Undergraduate Student Affairs Office: https://www.undergrad.socsci.uci.edu/policies/index.php

Visit the Global and International Studies website for a list of approved courses. Although some courses are listed in more than one focus, students may not double count a course for both their geographic and global focus areas. Study abroad counts as one course in the geographic focus.

name: G. Two quarters of INTL ST 183A:

child.name: One quarter of which must be taken during the junior or senior year as a capstone experience.

name: H. At least one quarter of international experience.

child.name: Majors are encouraged to study abroad through the Universityâ€™s Education Abroad Program (UCEAP) or the Independent Programs, which are available for periods of a quarter, year, or summer. When this is not possible, work overseas (through Independent Programs) or a domestic internship with the UCDC Internship Program, the UCI Washington D.C. Academic Internship Program, or Social Science Internship Program (SOC SCI 197) with an international focus may be substituted. Study abroad counts as one course in the regional focus.
